desc.title: OEB Website
desc.heading: Underscoring credibility through ease of use.
desc.copy: The Ontario Energy Board (OEB) is an independent regulatory body that monitors and regulates local utility distribution companies. It has two very distinct target audiences: the general public and industry partners. q30 created a new site to support these groups and to reinforce OEB’s advocacy position in a challenging energy market.
desc.services: User Experience Workshops, Information Architecture, Wireframes, Functional Prototypes, Visual Design, Code Development

images.item: In order to get upfront buy-in and ease decision making, q30 engaged the entire OEB team in a series of workshops. With no preset assumptions of what CMS  best suited the job, q30 researched the OEB's needs and requirements and then identified the ideal solution and development partner. We then acted as the conduit for all work from coding to billing. This was particularly important given the challenges the client faced with internal resources.

A rigorous system of UX testing was supported with regular user feedback gathering to validate navigation and inform information flow. The amount of information to be communicated was immense, so every bit of content was rewritten to be user focused and friendly. No complicated jargon or double speak was allowed.

img.alt: OEB website Rates and Bill page

images.item: A dynamic content architecture was developed to reduce input redundancy and increase accuracy. To further shore-up internal OEB resources, our project management was very ‘hands on’.
The new site employs best-in-class design and complies with Ontario's AODA accessibility regulations. Consumers can easily find everything from how rates are set, to help for low income families.

With our innovative utility performance dashboard, they can look-up their local utility to see how it’s performing against OEB targets. For more intrepid users, it allows easy deep dives into governance and the regulatory process. The industry section gives partners quick access to important resources on policies and industry relations.

img.alt: OEB website utility dashboard, mobile and tablet view

images.item: We are extremely proud of the OEB website. It was a big job, with all the hurdles and challenges inherent therein. Just the kind of project we love to sink our teeth into.

item.title: OEB Website, Ux, design and front–end development
item.meta: design, UX, front-end development, mobile

desc.title: IESO Website 2016
desc.heading: The merging of entities.
desc.copy: In January 2015 the Ontario Power Authority (OPA) and Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO) merged therefore a new website was required to reflect their expanded mandate. As IESO’s agency of record, q30 was lucky enough to do the work.The challenge? Developing a new site which would combine the content and structure of two separate and very different domains with two distinct audiences: a consumer-oriented audience and various sector partners.
desc.services: User Experience Workshops, Information Architecture, Wireframes, Functional Prototypes, Visual Design, Code Development

images.item: The sheer volume and inherent complication of data was staggering. Added to this were the natural challenges which arise out of communicating a large organizational shift both within the new organization and to all external stakeholders.

Working closely with a combined IESO/OPA team and using a determinedly user-first approach, q30 produced personas and user experience maps for eight distinct audiences, conducted over 20 stakeholder interviews, facilitated content modelling workshops, and implemented tree-testing to get proposed navigation feedback to inform everything from wireframes to content strategy.

img.alt: IESO website mobile and tablet view

images.item: The resulting design, architecture and navigation are a testament to the rigor of this user-focused approach.

img.alt: IESO website mobile and tablet view

images.item: The site, launched in March 2017, is receiving accolades from the industry and public alike. It is on brand, intuitive, easy to navigate and conforms completely with AODA standards using a responsive framework and a new robust content management solution. And yet it contains a depth of information which is simply breathtaking. Everything a good website which serves multiple stakeholders should be.

item.related: IESO Kilowatt Way, OHA Education Website,IESO 1KWH
item.title: IESO Website, Ux, design and front–end development
item.meta: design, UX, front-end development, mobile

desc.title: OHA Website
desc.heading: Two sites, one vision
desc.copy: OHA provides support through information, education and advocacy to its 130 plus member hospitals. As their Agency of Record, q30 was tasked with a complete redesign and build of the main OHA website which at the time incorporated industry relevant information and all of the educational offerings. Through research and consultation, we decided education needed to be physically and visually separated to better focus user goals.
desc.services: Content Strategy, Wireframes, Functional Prototype, Visual Design, User Testing, Full code development

img.alt: OHA and OHA Education website homepage

images.item: The OHA has internal committees that touch many different parts of the two sites and needed to be involved at every step, so we facilitated three half-day workshops to create personas, user journey maps, and sitemap and navigation schemes with card-sorting exercises. This helped to create immediate buy-in as everyone felt they got a chance to voice their opinion and affect the direction. We then produced wireframes demonstrating site and content structure, and moved quickly to visual concepts. We presented a variety of directions and came to a consensus on which ones to develop further.

Developing a coherent and manageable content strategy was key. The workshops saw the elimination and/or simplification of content. The content structure was also clearly defined so OHA staff had a solid template for adding new material. For efficiency, content became dynamic wherever possible.

The main OHA site was designed to be the gateway for more in depth industry information. In order to facilitate retrieval, content was sorted into ‘buckets’ and served up in easy to navigate categories ranging from professional issues, to legislation, and the ongoing transformation of the industry as a whole.

The education site was designed to be accessed on it’s own or through the main site and became a colourful, engaging, and content-rich storefront for educational products, programs, and services. Content was reorganized, with suggested search implemented to help make things easier to find. To maximize experience, promote discovery and encourage cross-relational interests, surfacing was employed to present options which users may not have known existed.

Launched in April 2017, the new sites offer users clean, organized and intuitive experiences, enabling them to easily access the information they need as professionals.

item.title: OHA website, UX, web design and development
item.meta: print, UX, web site, design, development

desc.title: OHA Education Website
desc.heading: Putting users on top of the learning curve
desc.copy: q30 is the agency of record for the OHA, which provides support to its 130 plus member hospitals throughout the province. A big part of what OHA does for its members is to offer over 250 continuing education opportunities through conferences, workshops, in-class, and digital learning to health care professionals affiliated with those institutions. The promotion of these revenue generating initiatives represents a significant portion of OHA’s revenue.
desc.services: Content Strategy, Wireframes, Functional Prototype, Visual Design, User Testing, Full code development

images.item: q30 was tasked with a complete redesign and build of the main OHA corporate website, of which the education site was a part. We determined that the two entities should be separated physically and visually to provide focus for two very different user goals.

img.alt: OHA main website and OHA Education website homepage

images.item: The OHA has large internal committees that touch many different parts of the two sites, and who needed to be involved and informed at every step. To help with this, we facilitated three half-day collaborative workshops to create personas, user journey maps, and sitemap and navigation schemes with card-sorting exercises. This created immediate buy-in from all, as they got a chance to voice their opinion and affect direction.

We then produced wireframes demonstrating site and content structure, and moved quickly to visual concepts. We presented a variety of directions and together came to a consensus on which ones to develop further.
We designed an easy navigation with simple topic focused categories and quick access to all OHA websites.
The education site became a colourful, engaging, and content-rich storefront for the OHA’s educational products, programs, and services.

Content was reorganized, with suggested search implemented to help make things easier for users to find. In order to maximize experience, promote discovery and encourage cross-relational interests, surfacing was employed to present options which users may not have known existed.

Developing a coherent and manageable content strategy was key for the success of this project. The results of our workshops saw the elimination and/or simplification of the existing content. We were also able to clearly define content structure for the education details pages so that OHA staff had a solid and understandable template with which to work when writing new material. In order to reduce the need to enter course information in multiple locations and reduce employee time updating, content became dynamic wherever possible.

item.title: OHA Education, UX, web design and development
item.meta: print, UX, web site, design, development

desc.title: Cumbrae’s Website
desc.heading: Craving inducing web design
desc.copy:
When it comes to butchers, Cumbrae’s is the gold standard Toronto brand for exceptional tasting meat and premium ready-to-serve food. Dry aged beef. Heritage pork. Foie gras. Smoked brisket. To-die-for daily sandwiches. Simply put: heaven on a plate.

When Cumbrae’s came to q30 to update their website, they felt it was important to tell the broader story of why their food is extraordinary. The fact that every succulent bite begins at the farms and with the farmers who are just as much a part of Cumbrae’s as their butcher shops.
desc.services: Content Strategy, Wireframes, Functional Prototype, Visual Design, User Testing, Full code development

images.item: We worked with food writer and culinary supporter, Ivy Knight, to develop copy for the site. The statement on the homepage “We don’t just deal with farmers, we are farmers. And butchers. And chefs.” is a bold and confident articulation of the Cumbrae’s advantage. It also draws a clear line between the farm and the store. This concept is reinforced with the inclusion of simple and beautiful videos which take you to the very pastures and barns of those farmers, and through the daily life at a Cumbrae’s store.
Further proof of the local origin of the food was illustrated through a map showing where the farms are located throughout the province.

But we didn’t stop there. We used hunger-inducing quotes from top-calibre chefs who have become food apostles for Cumbrae’s products. Real chefs who adore the meat Cumbrae’s sells, recognize the importance and benefits of supporting small Ontario farmers, and serve the meat in both their restaurants and their own homes with zeal. These third party endorsements act like a good béarnaise drizzled over one of Cumbrae’s own prime ribs!
Finally we integrated Instagram feeds by Cumbrae’s own staff and farmers. Gorgeous shots of the latest offerings, well raised animals, sizzling chops, tender tortellini, succulent steaks.
Are you hungry yet?

desc.title: IESO Kilowatt Way
desc.heading: Shedding light on energy conservation.
desc.copy: Click. Learn. Save. Our challenge was to build an educational microsite to allow residential consumers to understand their homes' electricity consumption and learn about conservation opportunities to better manage costs.
desc.services: Wireframes, Functional Prototype, Visual Design, Custom Illustration, User Testing, Full code development

images.item: Designed and developed completely in-house at q30, the site meets all AODA AA accessibility requirements and works efficiently on all devices using a combination of responsive and adaptive frameworks.
Using a simple and easy to understand 4 question format, consumers choose their home type, heating method, the number of rooms and people (and pets too!).

img.alt: Kilowatt Way ipad type of home selection functionality
Kilowatt Way question screen - how many rooms are in your home?
Kilowatt Way ipad room selection functionality
Kilowatt Way ipad room selection details
Kilowatt Way ipad people and pet selection functionality

images.item: The tool then calculates a baseline consumption and cost profile that the user can then modify to closely match, or try to reduce, their actual bill.
The tool enables the user to see how Time-of-Use directly impacts their energy cost.

img.alt: Kilowatt Way ipad energy usage details
Kilowatt Way summer background illustration detail
Kilowatt Way winter background illustration detail

images.item: We created a comprehensive set of sector specific icons, custom illustrations and subtle animations to make this site visually engaging and fun to explore.

item.title: IESO Kilowatt Way, UX, web design and development

desc.title: Social Capital Partners
desc.heading: Helping a non-profit tell their story and attract innovative partners.
desc.copy: Social Capital Partners (SCP) is a non-profit organization that develops new models to alleviate Canada’s employment challenges. It works with disabled people, new Canadians and those with employment barriers. Through partnerships with larger organizations, they create new models that improve access to sustainable employment. This is a challenging but important story to tell!
desc.services: Branding Development, Content Strategy, Wireframes, Functional Prototypes, Visual Design, Full integration with Wordpress

images.item: Josh Greenhut, a brand strategist, crafted a clear statement about their offering and process. q30 translated the statement into a visual identity that captures the spirit of the organization: a catalyst for change symbolized by a graphic depiction of a petri dish. This became the springboard for SCP to share their story.

The website supports the identity with infographics and a compelling narrative that offers an excellent overview of the organization for all site users – desktop, tablet and mobile. SCP’s partnerships with organizations act as a track record and make the selling process quicker and more efficient.

item.related: IESO web, HealthAchieve web, Sorrell Financial
item.title: Social Capital Partners, branding, collaterol and web design
item.meta: branding, print, web site, design, development

desc.title: HealthAchieve Website
desc.heading: Making it easy to navigate the biggest health conference in Canada.
desc.copy: HealthAchieve has been the signature conference and exhibition of the Ontario Hospital Association (OHA) for over 90 years. It is one of the largest and most respected health care events in North America, featuring over 200 speakers, 50 educational sessions and close to 300 exhibitors showcasing the latest health care products, services and technologies.
desc.services: User Experience Workshops, Persona Development, Experience Journey Maps, Content Strategy, Wireframes, Functional Prototypes, Visual Design, User Testing, Front-end coding

images.item: The HealthAchieve website has an audience of delegates including CEOs, trustees, administrators and clinicians from the healthcare sector and beyond, and over 300 exhibitors and sponsors.

We built a dynamic, fresh, intuitive and responsive site for all audiences. We determined that if the site was a success from a UX perspective, OHA could limit the need for print communications that are a demand on internal resources and budgets. The site also offers the ability to reach a much greater audience throughout the lifecycle of the event.
Our biggest challenge was how to organize over 250 concurrent events across three different locations over a three-day period into a single coherent, intuitive and interactive schedule.

All aspects of the user experience were meticulously studied, applied and tested with this end goal in mind: to allow the user to find the information quickly and in whatever way on whatever device suits them best.

item.title: HealthAchieve Website, Ux, design and front–end development

desc.title: TD Bank reporting
desc.heading: Delivering best-in-class reporting to a global audience.
desc.copy: q30 design inc. has enjoyed a successful uninterrupted relationship with TD for an unprecedented two decades! This type of long-term collaboration is unique in the creative services industry, especially with turnover of staff on the client-side during that time frame. We have provided a consistent point of contact and serve as the intellectual memory for many of their communications requirements.
desc.services: Content Planning, Storyboards, Visual Design, Infographics, Print Production, Full Website Development

images.item: For 20 consecutive years we’ve delivered the Bank’s Annual Report and Quarterly Reports. The annual report has grown to include a 224 page printed report in English and French, and a fully interactive digital report with video.

All materials are designed and developed completely in-house. Other reports created during this time include the Bank’s Pension Fund Annual Reports, TD Ombudsman Annual Report and numerous internal communications in digital and print formats.
We are adept at working with TD’s stringent corporate brand standards for digital and print marketing communications to ensure a consistent brand presentation.

The design and production of TD’s Corporate Responsibility Report over several years include interactive PDFs and the full design and production of the entire CSR section of td.com. Loads of data visualization and infographic techniques were used to illustrate the bank’s activities and have helped make these reports consistently best-in-class.
q30 has also designed many print and interactive presentations, newsletters, and reports for senior management and other internal audiences.
